citeinfo.origin:
C. Hans Nelson of the U. S. Geological Survey (USGS), Menlo Park, California 94025, U.S.A.
Swie-Djin Nio of the Comparative Sedimentology Division, University of Utrecht, The Netherlands
citeinfo.title: The Northeastern Bering Shelf: New Perspectives of Epicontinental Shelf Processes and Depositional Products - An Introduction

abstract.p: This introductory paper describes the following volume dealing with a decade of interdisciplinary research on Holocene sedimentation in the northern Bering Sea. The US Geological Survey environment assessment studies in this region brought together the work of a number of marine geologists, physical oceanographers, geochemists and Geotechnical specialists. Those epicontinental shelf research focuses on a poorly known, but major environment of northern North America.

[Reference: Nelson, C.H. and S-D Nio. 1982. The Northeastern Bering Shelf: New Perspectives of Epicontinental Shelf Processes and Depositional Products - An Introduction. Geologie en Mijnbouw. 61(1): 2-4.]
This volume may be found at many university libraries.

descript.purpose: To introduce a volume on Bering Sea shelf processes.
